section.heading: Synopsis
section.content: This class allows you to interact with the temperate aspect of the weather.

property.name: unit
property.description: This variable will control how the weather interprets the temperature, and allows for conversion. Can be either "F", "C", or "K".

property.name: value
property.description: The numerical value of the temperature. The value can be changed my various methods to convert between units, and can also be directly modified by code.

method.name: toCelcius()
method.description: Will attempt to change value property to the correct Celcius value. Changes the unit property as well. Returns the new value.

method.name: toFahrenheit()
method.description: Will attempt to change value property to the correct Fahrenheit value. Changes the unit property as well. Returns the new value.

method.name: toKelvin()
method.description: Will attempt to change value property to the correct Kelvin value. Changes the unit property as well. Returns the new value.

section.heading: Remark
section.content: Created by scoutchorton. Based on the following challenge:
section.quote: Implement a function that will accept a numeric argument to represent a temperature value and a string argument to represent a unit of temperature measurement. Temperature arguments should be any integer or real number. Unit argument should include [C]elsius, [F]ahrenheit, and [K]elvin. The function should display the given temperature in each of the other systems. The return value should be true if the conversion was successful and false otherwise.
